page.title: 01Country south of Llandudno
page.content: The whole block, lying betwen A470 and B5113 in County Gwynedd, North Wales, is very hilly with a general slope from East to West: it is all rough grazing for sheep with a few catle. Bodnant Gardens stand in the southwest corner. Among the finest gardens in the country it extends for eighty acres and gives spectcular views of the Snowdonia Range. Just north of Bodnant on the A470, are the snowdonia Nurseries and the Bryn Mynan Nurseries. Adjacent, on the west side of the road is the Felin Issaf Watermill. (17th Century) open to the public. In square six there is an ncient Earthwork, and square eight is the site of a Television/Radio mast.
